intro: Tribulus brachystylis, commonly known as the short-styled Tribulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tribulus brachystylis is often found in sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
